articles.content:
A mystery respiratory illness has stricken 10 people in Argentina, killing three, as health officials scramble to find out what's causing the malady that includes pneumonia, fever and abdominal pain.

articles.title: Attack raises doubts about Argentine VP's security protocols
articles.description: An apparent assassination attempt on the vice president of Argentina is raising questions about her security protocols and her habit of pressing the flesh with supporters.

articles.title: Don’t take democracy for granted, warns director of Argentine junta film
articles.description: Comments at Venice film festival come after recent failed assassination attempt on Argentina’s vice-president
articles.content:
A failed assassination attempt this week on the Argentine vice-president has shown that democracy cannot be taken for granted, the director behind a courtroom drama about the trial of Argentina’s military junta has said.

articles.title: Mystery cluster of pneumonia cases in Argentina being monitored by World Health Organisation
articles.description: Tests for known respiratory viruses and other viral, bacterial and fungal agents were all negative.
articles.content:
The World Health Organisation is monitoring a cluster of pneumonia cases from an unknown cause in Argentina, in an outbreak that so far has included three deaths.
The 10 cases are linked to a single private clinic in the city of San Miguel de Tucuman... [1081 chars]

articles.title: Failed assassination gives extra punch to Argentine courtroom drama
articles.description: A failed assassination attempt this week on the Argentine vice president has provided a foreboding backdrop to powerful courtroom drama "Argentina 1985", which opened at the Venice Film Festival on Saturday. Santiago Mitre's movie follows the prosecutors who, despite death threats and enormous legal difficulties, brought members of Argentina's 1976-1983 military dictatorship to trial in 1985.
articles.content:

articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of Argentines descended on the capital's main plaza on Friday in a show of solidarity in the aftermath of a shocking
